course_title: Topics in Hispanic Culture: Journalism and the Arts
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 15 / Seats Avail: 12Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
A survey of the intersection of journalism, literature, and the arts across the Americas, with a focus on Latin America. We study the history of journalism and modern print culture, with a focus on the 20th century and the rise of mass readership. Films, artworks, and literature from Mexico, Chile, Colombia, and the U.S. provide examples of the intersections between journalism and the arts. 
Prerequisite: At least one Foundational course (SPAN 300-318W) or permission from the instructor.
course_description: Upper-level research seminar on topics related to the language, discourse, literature, and/or culture of the Hispanic world. Students may take multiple SPAN 485 courses provided that they focus on different topics.
